content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. learn different languages
2. explore the world
3. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 16:51:30 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As a system, I successfully completed a command to generate an image with prompts for language learning resources and travel destinations, which was saved to disk. My user then gave me a command to search for "top language learning resources" using Google, which returned a list of URLs. Afterward, my user requested a text summary of the top language learning resources from the URL "https://www.theintrepidguide.com/top-language-learning-resources/". The command was successful, and I received a response with a list of various language learning resources. Later, my user requested a text summary of the best online apps and courses to learn a new language from the URL "https://www.businessinsider.com/guides/learning/best-online-apps-courses-to-learn-new-language", but an error message appeared. However, I was able to successfully retrieve a text summary of the top language learning resources from the URL "https://www.alllanguageresources.com/" using the command "get_text_summary". The article provides a list of the top 10 apps and online platforms to learn a new language, including Rosetta Stone, Duolingo, Babbel, Memrise, Busuu, FluentU, Mondly, Fluent City, Fluenz, and Rype. It also includes information on the pricing, pros, and cons of each platform.

Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : The text does not provide a clear list of the top language learning resources. Instead, it offers reviews and recommendations for various language learning resources, including apps, courses, podcasts, and exchange programs, for a wide range of languages. The reviews are independent and aim to help language learners find the best tools for their needs.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "I have received a summary of the information on the fourth website. I'll use the 'generate_image' command to generate an image of the top language learning resources and travel destinations.",
        "reasoning": "I have gathered information on the top language learning resources and travel destinations. Using the 'generate_image' command will allow me to create a visual representation of the information that my user can easily refer to.",
        "plan": "- Use the 'get_text_summary' command to get a summary of the information on each website
- Read through the summaries and gather the most important information
- Use the information to decide on a language to start learning and a destination to visit
- Use the 'generate_image' command to generate an image of the top language learning resources and travel destinations
- Use the 'google' command to search for top language learning resources
- Use the 'get_text_summary' command to get a summary of the information on each website",
        "criticism": "I need to make sure that the image accurately represents the information I have gathered. I should also consider including additional information that my user may find helpful.",
        "speak": "I have received a summary of the information on the fourth website. I'll use the 'generate_image' command to generate an image of the top language learning resources and travel destinations."
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "generate_image",
        "args": {
            "prompt": "Top Language Learning Resources and Travel Destinations

Language Learning Resources:
- Duolingo
- Rosetta Stone
- Babbel
- Pimsleur
- Memrise

Travel Destinations:
- South Africa
- Morocco
- Egypt
- Tanzania
- Kenya"
        }
    }
}
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : The text provides a list of 16 language learning tools and apps, including Mondly, italki, uTalk, Glossika, Busuu, Babbel, LingQ, Duolingo, Memrise, LinguaLift, Tandem, Michel Thomas, Uncovered Beginner Courses by Olly Richards, Coffee Break Languages, Bite-Size Immersive Audio Courses by Actual Fluency, and Pimsleur. However, the text also mentions 26 language learning resources in total, including language exchange websites, podcasts, and courses. The author emphasizes the importance of finding the right resources and methods for individual language learners and offers tips for improving language learning, as well as exclusive discounts for some of the resources mentioned. The text also offers a free eBook download with 78 dictionaries and a free guide with 22 key travel phrases.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
